tag.description: HTML DOCTYPE
The <html> element represents the root of a document.

attribute.description: A key label or list of key labels with which to associate the element; each key label represents a keyboard shortcut which UAs can use to activate the element or give focus to the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: A name of a classification, or list of names of classifications, to which the element belongs. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: ("true" or "false")Specifies whether the contents of the element are editable.
attribute.name: contenteditable

attribute.description: The value of the id attribute on the menu with which to associate the element as a context menu.
attribute.name: contextmenu

attribute.description: ("ltr" or "rtl" or "auto")Specifies the element’s text directionality.
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: ("true" or "false")Specifies the element’s text directionality.
attribute.name: draggable

attribute.description: Specifies what types of content can be dropped on the element, and instructs the UA about which actions to take with content when it is dropped on the element.
attribute.name: dropzone

attribute.description: Specifies that the element represents an element that is not yet, or is no longer, relevant.
attribute.name: hidden

attribute.description: A unique identifier for the element.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies the primary language for the contents of the element and for any of the element’s attributes that contain text.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: ("true" or "false")Specifies whether the element represents an element whose contents are subject to spell checking and grammar checking.
attribute.name: spellcheck

attribute.description: Specifies zero or more CSS declarations that apply to the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Specifies whether the element represents an element that is is focusable (that is, an element which is part of the sequence of focusable elements in the document), and the relative order of the element in the sequence of focusable elements in the document.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: Advisory information associated with the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: ("yes" or "no")Specifies whether an element’s attribute values and contents of its children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.
attribute.name: translate

attribute.description: Load of element was aborted by the user.
attribute.name: onabort

attribute.description: Element lost focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: The UA estimates that if playback were to be started now, the video or audio element could be rendered at the current playback rate all the way to its end without having to stop for further buffering.
attribute.name: oncanplay

attribute.description: User committed a change to the value of element (form control).
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: User pressed pointer button down and released pointer button over element, or otherwise activated the pointer in a manner that emulates such an action.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: User requested the context menu for element.
attribute.name: oncontextmenu

attribute.description: User clicked pointer button twice over element, or otherwise activated the pointer in a manner that simulates such an action.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: User is continuing to drag element.
attribute.name: ondrag

attribute.description: User ended dragging element.
attribute.name: ondragend

attribute.description: User’s drag operation entered element.
attribute.name: ondragenter

attribute.description: User’s drag operation left element.
attribute.name: ondragleave

attribute.description: User is continuing drag operation over element.
attribute.name: ondragover

attribute.description: User started dragging element.
attribute.name: ondragstart

attribute.description: User completed drop operation over element.
attribute.name: ondrop

attribute.description: The DOM attribute "duration" on the video or audio element has been updated.
attribute.name: ondurationchange

attribute.description: The video or audio element has returned to the uninitialized state.
attribute.name: onemptied

attribute.description: The end of the video or audio element has been reached.
attribute.name: onended

attribute.description: Element failed to load properly.
attribute.name: onerror

attribute.description: Element received focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: User changed the value of element (form control).
attribute.name: oninput

attribute.description: Element (form control) did not meet validity constraints.
attribute.name: oninvalid

attribute.description: User pressed down a key.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: User pressed down a key that is associated with a character value.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: User released a key.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Element finished loading.
attribute.name: onload

attribute.description: UA can render the video or audio element at the current playback position for the first time.
attribute.name: onloadeddata

attribute.description: UA has just determined the duration and dimensions of the video or audio element.
attribute.name: onloadedmetadata

attribute.description: UA has begun looking for media data in the video or audio element.
attribute.name: onloadstart

attribute.description: User pressed down pointer button over element.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: User moved mouse.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: User moved pointer off boundaries of element.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: User moved pointer into boundaries of element or one of its descendant elements.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: User released pointer button over element.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: User rotated wheel of mouse or other device in a manner that emulates such an action.
attribute.name: onmousewheel

attribute.description: User has paused playback of the video or audio element.
attribute.name: onpause

attribute.description: UA has initiated playback of the video or audio element.
attribute.name: onplay

attribute.description: Playback of the video or audio element has started.
attribute.name: onplaying

attribute.description: UA is fetching media data for the video or audio element.
attribute.name: onprogress

attribute.description: Either the DOM attribute "defaultPlaybackRate" or the DOM attribute "playbackRate" on the video or audio element has been updated.
attribute.name: onratechange

attribute.description: Element and all its subresources have finished loading.
attribute.name: onreadystatechange

attribute.description: The form element was reset.
attribute.name: onreset

attribute.description: Element or document view was scrolled.
attribute.name: onscroll

attribute.description: The value of the IDL attribute "seeking" changed to "false" (a seek operation on the video or audio element ended).
attribute.name: onseeked

attribute.description: The value of the IDL attribute "seeking" changed to "true", and the seek operation on the video or audio elements is taking long enough that the UA has time to fire the "seeking" event.
attribute.name: onseeking

attribute.description: User selected some text.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: User requested the element be shown as a context menu.
attribute.name: onshow

attribute.description: UA is attempting to fetch media data for the video or audio element, but that data is not forthcoming.
attribute.name: onstalled

attribute.description: The form element was submitted.
attribute.name: onsubmit

attribute.description: UA is intentionally not currently fetching media data for the video or audio element, but does not yet have the entire contents downloaded.
attribute.name: onsuspend

attribute.description: The current playback position of the video or audio element changed either as part of normal playback, or in an especially interesting way (for example, discontinuously).
attribute.name: ontimeupdate

attribute.description: Either the DOM attribute "volume" or the DOM attribute "muted" on the video or audio element has been changed.
attribute.name: onvolumechange

attribute.description: Playback of the video or audio element has stopped because the next frame is not yet available (but UA agent expects that frame to become available in due course).
attribute.name: onwaiting

attribute.description: The address of the document’s application cache manifest (which controls caching of content for offline use).
attribute.name: manifest

tag.description: The <div> element has no special meaning at all. It represents its children. It can be used with the class, lang, and title attributes to mark up semantics common to a group of consecutive elements.

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns an Object (the toString() of which is called to derive the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.
attribute.name: action

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing where the event came from, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "some action happened".

attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The current value of this component.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A key label or list of key labels with which to associate the element; each key label represents a keyboard shortcut which UAs can use to activate the element or give focus to the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: A name of a classification, or list of names of classifications, to which the element belongs. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.name: dropzone

attribute.description: Specifies that the element represents an element that is not yet, or is no longer, relevant.
attribute.name: hidden

attribute.description: A unique identifier for the element.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies the primary language for the contents of the element and for any of the element’s attributes that contain text.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.name: spellcheck

attribute.description: Specifies zero or more CSS declarations that apply to the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: Specifies whether the element represents an element that is is focusable (that is, an element which is part of the sequence of focusable elements in the document), and the relative order of the element in the sequence of focusable elements in the document.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: Advisory information associated with the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: ("yes" or "no")Specifies whether an element’s attribute values and contents of its children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.
attribute.name: translate

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns an Object (the toString() of which is called to derive the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.
attribute.name: action

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing where the event came from, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "some action happened".

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing what the new value is, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "this value changed".

attribute.description: "hard": Instructs the UA to insert line breaks into the submitted value of the textarea such that each line has no more characters than the value specified by the cols attribute. "soft": Instructs the UA to add no line breaks to the submitted value of the textarea.
attribute.name: wrap

attribute.description: Specifies that the element represents a control to which a UA is meant to give focus as soon as the document is loaded.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.name: required

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a validator method that will be called during Process Validations to perform correctness checks on the value of this component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, with a return type of void.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: A ValueExpression enabled attribute that, if present, will be used as the text of the validator message, replacing any message that comes from the validator.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing what the new value is, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "this value changed".
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing what the new value is, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "this value changed".

attribute.description: Converter instance registered with this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: A ValueExpression enabled attribute that, if present, will be used as the text of the converter message, replacing any message that comes from the converter.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: Flag indicating that this component's value must be converted and validated immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase), rather than waiting until Process Validations phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: A ValueExpression enabled attribute that, if present, will be used as the text of the validation message for the "required" facility, if the "required" facility is used.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a validator method that will be called during Process Validations to perform correctness checks on the value of this component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, with a return type of void.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: A ValueExpression enabled attribute that, if present, will be used as the text of the validator message, replacing any message that comes from the validator.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: MethodExpression representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void, or to a public method that takes no arguments with a return type of void. In the latter case, the method has no way of easily knowing what the new value is, but this can be useful in cases where a notification is needed that "this value changed".
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: A key label or list of key labels with which to associate the element; each key label represents a keyboard shortcut which UAs can use to activate the element or give focus to the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: A name of a classification, or list of names of classifications, to which the element belongs. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: ("true" or "false")Specifies whether the contents of the element are editable.
attribute.name: contenteditable

attribute.description: The value of the id attribute on the menu with which to associate the element as a context menu.
attribute.name: contextmenu

attribute.description: ("ltr" or "rtl" or "auto")Specifies the element’s text directionality.
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: ("true" or "false")Specifies the element’s text directionality.

attribute.description: A unique identifier for the element.

attribute.description: Advisory information associated with the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: ("yes" or "no")Specifies whether an element’s attribute values and contents of its children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.
attribute.name: translate
